00001 /*
00002  *    Filename: mmudefs.h
00003  *
00004  *    Purpose:  User definitions for the MM package
00005  *
00006  *    Copyright: C 2008 Sierra Wireless All rights reserved
00007  *
00008  */
00009 
00010 #ifndef mmudefs_h
00011 #define mmudefs_h
00012 
00013 #include "os/swi_ossdk.h"
00014 #include "dl/dludefs.h"
00015 #include "er/erudefs.h"
00016 
00017 /*
00018  * Name:    mmretcode
00019  *
00020  * Purpose: Enumerated list of return codes from the MM package
00021  *          to callers of its global entry points
00022  *
00023  * Members: MMDONE     - Successful return, requested operation complete
00024  *          MMNOMEM    - Unable to allocate memory from the operatin 
00025  *          MMBADPARM  - There is a problem with one of the calling args
00026  *          MMBADPOOL  - The poolp is wrong or the pool is not initialized
00027  *          MMBADBUF   - The buffer pointer does not point to a valid buffer
00028  *          MMPOOLEMPTY - All the free blocks in the pool have been allocated
00029  *
00030  * Note:    The first and last entries in the list are for range checking
00031  *          purposes, if required
00032  *
00033  */
00034 enum mmretcode {
00035     MMRETMIN = 0,
00036     MMDONE = MMRETMIN,
00037     MMNOMEM, 
00038     MMBADPARM,
00039     MMBADPOOL,
00040     MMBADBUF,
00041     MMPOOLEMPTY,
00042     MMRETMAX
00043 };
00044 
00045 /*
00046  * Name:    mmpool
00047  *
00048  * Purpose: This definition is provided so that users can allocate
00049  *          sufficient storage for their memory pool structures. 
00050  *          However, users are forbidden from manipulating the
00051  *          contents of this structure and can only pass a pointer
00052  *          to it into MM package global functions when
00053  *          required.
00054  *
00055  * Members: mmnextp - Pointer to the pool header structure of the 
00056  *                    neighbouring pool (optional for debugging)
00057  *          mmfreep - Pointer to the free block list. 
00058  *          mmnamep - Pointer to a NULL-terminated character string
00059  *                    containing the name of this pool
00060  *          mmvalid - A sentinel value that indicates whether the 
00061  *                    pool has been initialized or not
00062  *          mmnumbks- Number of blocks in the pool
00063  *          mmblocksz - Size of the User-portion of each block
00064  *          mmfirstp - Address of the first block for debugging purpose
00065  *          mmlastp - Address of the last block in the pool
00066  *          mmsemaph - Semaphore used to make accessing a pool a thread-
00067  *                    safe operation
00068  *          mmblog  - flag to mark pool for logging 
00069  *
00070  * Notes:   The free list is implemented as a singly-linked list
00071  *          so that the "mmfreep" points to the *last* block in 
00072  *          the list and the last block always points to the 
00073  *          first block in the list. 
00074  *
00075  *          The "mmbufhdr" pointer is defined within the mmidefs.h
00076  *          file and external packages don't need to know about it
00077  *
00078  */
00079 struct mmpool
00080 {
00081     struct mmpool *mmnextp;
00082     struct mmbufhdr *mmfreep;
00083     char *mmnamep;
00084     swi_uint32 mmvalid;
00085     swi_uint32 mmnumblocks;
00086     swi_uint32 mmblocksize;
00087     swi_uint8 *mmfirstp;
00088     swi_uint8 *mmlastp;
00089     struct swi_ossemaphore mmsemaph;
00090     swi_bool    mmblog;
00091 };
00092 
00093 #include "mmuproto.h"
00094 
00095 #endif
